New Records: Rilee Rossouw struck the first century of this T20 World Cup.
South Africa achieved the 2022 edition's highest total.
Rossouw and Quinton de Kock added 163 for the second wicket, the second-highest partnership in the tournament's history.
Anrich Nortje finished with his best T20I figures of 4-10.
It is now Bangladesh's biggest defeat in this format.
Key Match Events: Quinton de Kock scored 63 off 38 balls.
Anrich Nortje took 4 wickets for 10 runs.
South Africa had to endure a 22-minute rain-break during the Powerplay.
Shakib went for 21 in his first over, including five penalty runs.
Taskin Ahmed conceded 23 runs in the 14th over.
Mahmud led Bangladesh's fightback, giving away just 12 runs in two of the last three overs.
Shakib removed Rossouw in the 19th over.
Soumya Sarkar smashed two sixes off Kagiso Rabada in the first over.
Nortje blew away Bangladesh's top order in his first two overs.
Rabada got Afif Hossain to be caught at mid-off in the sixth over.
Tristan Stubbs dropped Litton Das on 17.
Shamsi removed Mehidy Hasan Miraz, Nurul Hasan, and Litton Das in three consecutive overs.
Keshav Maharaj had Mosaddek Hossain stumped in the 11th over.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play, reducing the game to 20 overs per side.
